title: Data is Money
description: Understanding what financial data is, how AI uses it, and why it matters.

sections.heading: What is Data?
sections.text: Data refers to information collected from various sources. In finance, this includes spending habits, income, payments, and credit history.

sections.heading: Types of Financial Data
list: Behavioral Data – where, when, and how you spend

sections.heading: Why Data Matters to AI
sections.text: AI depends on data to make predictions, identify trends, and give personalized advice. More data means smarter financial insights.

chapters.title: How Your Financial Habits Create Data

sections.heading: Daily Financial Actions
sections.text: Every financial decision, big or small, generates data. From shopping to paying bills, each action builds your financial profile.

sections.heading: How AI Learns from Your Data

chapters.title: Benefits of Using AI to Manage Money

sections.heading: Personalized Guidance
sections.text: AI suggests saving opportunities, budgeting improvements, and investment ideas.

sections.heading: Time Savings
sections.text: AI automates calculations, budgeting, and analysis to reduce manual work.

sections.heading: Better Financial Health
sections.text: AI helps prevent overspending and offers real-time financial insights.
